content:
I am a Machine Learning Engineer at Adobe, based in Bangalore. I earned my bachelor’s degree in E&CE from the Indian Institute of Technology, Roorkee. Concurrently, I work with Prof. Angel Xuan Chang, conducting research on conditional 3D scene generation at her lab in Simon Fraser University. Previously, I contributed to the groundbreaking research at Rephrase.ai (now part of Adobe) by leveraging generative AI for human avatar technologies.
My research at the GIST Computer Vision Lab, which also formed the basis of my undergraduate thesis, focused on developing embodied agents for vision and language navigation. During my time at the University of British Columbia (Summer 2021), I worked on developing efficient but accurate language models for software engineering tasks. My research interests are in computer vision and robotics, with a specialty in machine learning and (tractable) generative modeling.
At IIT Roorkee, I was a core member of a Deep Learning research centric reading group named the Vision and Language Group, and the IEEE Student Chapter, IIT Roorkee.
summary: I am a Machine Learning Engineer at Adobe, based in Bangalore. I earned my bachelor’s degree in E&CE from the Indian Institute of Technology, Roorkee. Concurrently, I work with Prof.
title: Divyam Goel

title: Divyam Goel
Semi‑NMF Regularization‑Based Autoencoder Training for Hyperspectral Unmixing

summary: Embodied AI Workshop @ CVPR 2022. The 2nd Embodied AI Workshop (EAI' 22)
title: Language Guided Meta Control for Embodied Instruction Following

summary: SocialNLP @ NAACL 2022. The 10th International Workshop on Natural Language Processing for Social Media (SocialNLP '22)
title: Leveraging Dependency Grammar for Fine-Grained Offensive Language Detection using Graph Convolutional Networks

summary: ICPC 2022. 30th International Conference on Program Comprehension (ICPC '22)
title: On the Cross Modal Transfer From Natural Language to Code Through Adapter Modules

summary: PyTorch code for experiments with a semi-NMF based regularization objective over multiple autoencoder architectures for hyperspectral unmixing. [`CODE`](https://github.com/dv-fenix/SemiNMF-Autoencoders/)
title: SemiNMF-Autoencoders

summary: A dataset consisting of 11,400 python codes for a retrieval based code clone detection. [`LINK`](https://zenodo.org/record/5388452#.Ybd82y8RqJ9)
title: Super Code Clone Detection - 88

summary: PyTorch reproduction of the paper titled 'Hyperspectral Unmixing Using a Neural Network Autoencoder' (Palsson et al. 2018). [`CODE`](https://github.com/dv-fenix/HyperspecAE)
title: HyperspecAE

summary: Led a collaborative effort to develop an agent that predicts consumer churn in the Indian Telecom Industry. [`REPORT`](/files/MRreport.pdf) [`DEMO`](https://telecom-churn-pred.herokuapp.com/)
title: Customer Churn Management

summary: Implemented some Policy Gradient RL algorithms (using PyTorch) on the CartPole environment by OpenAI. [`CODE`](https://github.com/dv-fenix/ReinforcementLearning)
title: Policy Gradient Methods

summary: Trying to utilize a large pre-trained language model to build a English-Hindi machine translation system. [`CODE`](https://github.com/dv-fenix/ITR)
title: Indic-Language Translation

summary: Fine-Tuning a BERT model for Sentiment Classification on the SMILE: Twitter Emotion Dataset. [`CODE`](https://github.com/dv-fenix/SentimentClassification)
title: Sentiment Analysis with BERT

summary: Developed a Web Application using Flask and StreamLit for the visualization of the weights on neural network. [`CODE`](https://github.com/dv-fenix/NNVisualizer)
title: NNVisualizer

summary: Designed an autonomous vehicle using a combination of image processing and IoT methods. [`CODE`](https://github.com/dv-fenix/sdc) [`DEMO`](https://drive.google.com/drive/folders/1a9_sL_4uRCQaQuHgoHzgnGEBgMN6eqTH?usp=sharing)
title: Self Driving Car
